programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan Dotson returns to the auctions in Costa Mesa, California, where the buyers have their sights set on rival Dave Hester on his home turf.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimi Hendrix's former photographer visits the shop with a selection of unpublished pictures, and the team values two dune buggies and a 1930s denim jacket.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick values a device for predicting the outcome of horse races, and is shocked when a customer brings in a secret service ID and some counterfeit money.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A champion driver and a track owner from the Nascar motor racing circuit challenge Rick to design a trophy for a high-profile race.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale examines a 100-year-old mutoscope, while his brother and his son take an interest in a tandem they spot in a client's house.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie's team springs into action when a trailer of pharmaceuticals runs into a block of ice, and there's further chaos when a truckload of chickens crashes.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: Someone who supposedly possesses the ability to lift objects with his mind, a man who lives with a pack of wolves, and a diver who can reach depths that defy science.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Detectives in Arizona investigate whether a 20-year-old woman could be the latest victim of an unstoppable gunman's shooting spree.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: Armed with a budget of Â£1,000, the teams scour the scrapyards in search of fast cars such as Ferraris and Porsches. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto explores the terrifying concept of mind control, meeting an alleged victim implanted with an electronic harassment device in his head.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto tackles the ultimate existential question as he explores what happens when people die and whether or not there is life after death.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After two challenging rounds of signature crafting, two bladesmiths are tasked with recreating a beautiful but deadly Indonesian sword, the kelewang.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths make canister damascus using nuts and bolts. Two smiths advance to the final round where they must recreate a pair of deadly Indian Bagh Nakh weapons.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer calls in their lawyer to settle a row over a fake receipt, but Les has a trick up his sleeve.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley challenges Seth to a unique competition in the shop, and should he lose, the one thing he has been trying to keep a secret will be revealed.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les loses his temper when the kids suggest he should sell their failing second store, while Seth decides to put a sneaky plan into action.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth's plan to sell the Pontiac shop hits a snag and Ashley is pulled into the fray, and a meeting with a potential buyer leaves them facing a life-changing situation.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders head for the East Texas town of Tyler, where Jenny finds a valuable piece of musical memorabilia - but one of her competitors ends up out of pocket.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba try to keep their lucky streak going as the bidders return to old haunts, while Jenny discovers her inner ballerina.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Bubba faces a tough decision, and Matt Blevins enters into a battle of the sexes with female bidders in the small town of Pantego.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Kenny Stowe shows off his wealth during an auction in Dallas, and Bubba responds by challenging him to a bidding war.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Excuse Me, I Think You're Stupid
programme.desc: The competition gets fierce at an auction in Fort Worth, where Cowboy Matt and Kenny fight over an abandoned item of furniture.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Kenny acquires a locker full of martial arts equipment that puts him in a compromising position. Mary reveals the extent of her ambition and Jenny uses underhand tactics.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chumlee are offered a Bugs Bunny poster signed by voice artist Mel Blanc, and also consider buying a golf club once owned by Dean Martin.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee shares his experience of running a successful pawn shop with Antwan, and the team values a rare Second World War artefact.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer offers the team a gambling set - complete with concealed weapons - while Chumlee questions the value of a Snoop Dogg doll.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee takes over from Antwaun as the shop's security guard, while the team values a drum from the American Civil War and a motorcycle club uniform.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Customers offer the team some spooky artefacts during Halloween, including a 19th-century vampire-killing kit and a set of equipment used in paranormal investigations.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to get a good price on a fighter jet, as well as a baseball bat and glove signed by acclaimed player Babe Ruth.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff put a price on a 1940s mandolin, and try to determine if a signed print of Abraham Lincoln is genuine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a poster signed by Steve McQueen, and examine a diary from the American Civil War - but have a hard time making sense of the writing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimi Hendrix's former photographer visits the shop with a selection of unpublished pictures, and the team values two dune buggies and a 1930s denim jacket.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick values a device for predicting the outcome of horse races, and is shocked when a customer brings in a secret service ID and some counterfeit money.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos contemplates whether aliens that once visited Earth deliberately left a series of clues that mankind was eventually meant to decipher. Many ancient sites, and even recent ones like Roswell, all seem to be associated with reports of something coming down from the sky. Tsoukalos' research demonstrates that many of these places share a common symbol or shape-concentric circles. What is the significance of these designs, and is it possible they contain a coded message left by alien visitors?.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: A shocking new discovery at Smith's Cove suggests that the origin of the Oak Island mystery may date much earlier, and be more profound, than the treasure hunters suspected.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts visit an ancient fortress in Peru believed to have been built by aliens using tools far more advanced than those thought to have been available to humans at the time.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The Dwarfers are marooned on Earth in AD23 and must find a battery to power up the Returner Remote if they are going to make it home. Comedy series, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Rob Brydon, Lee Mack and David Mitchell feature in a special episode of out-takes, looking back over some of the best moments. Among the celebrity guests are Kevin Bishop, Warwick Davis, Romesh Ranganathan, Hugh Dennis, Sara Cox and Brian Blessed.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Richard Osman, Tom Courtenay, Sara Pascoe and Chris Kamara. As usual, all participants will be hoping to deceive one another with plausible lies, such as Richard stating he has never seen Breaking Bad because of his Homes Under the Hammer addiction, Sir Tom claiming he enjoys whiskey on his Christmas morning cornflakes, and Chris explaining that his full name is actually Christmas Kamara. The team also presents a somewhat unusual take on the Nativity.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Phill Jupitus and Bridget Christie and Only Connect presenter Victoria Coren Mitchell join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of public and private.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Comedians Desiree Burch, Chris Ramsey and Lost Voice Guy are given the titles of real lectures and invited to give their own version. Presented by Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.sub-title: If You're Happy and You Know It
programme.desc: Carol is feeling depressed about Gail's absence, so Tandy takes her on the honeymoon vacation they never had.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: The first moments of the deadly virus outbreak are revealed through a special lens.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Jay Leno's Garage
programme.desc: Jay meets NASCAR star Joey Logano, and explores autonomous driving in a Tesla.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to discover if they can go motor racing for less than it costs to play golf. There's also a double helping of guests, with rock star Slash and Formula One driver Kimi Raikkonen taking to the track in Reasonably Priced Cars. Richard also gets behind the wheel of the BMW M5, which is powered by a twin-turbo V8 engine instead of the high-revving V10 of its predecessor.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and the Taylor brothers set their sights on some vintage military equipment.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are unsure of how to react when Jesse's bidding becomes aggressive.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In an antique shop closed since the 1970s, Mike and Frank go toe-to-toe with the sibling owners who negotiate for every last dollar.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys uncover a once-in-a-lifetime find and must decide to go big or go home. Mike gets down-and-dirty to rescue an old piece from Mother Nature.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A car that had failed to stop then reverses at speed down a footpath, hitting the door of a police car. Officers assist security guards in a tower block by removing two women.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Two teenagers throwing bricks engage in a rooftop stand-off with police, and officers seize a mobility car as the provider believes it has been used in crime.

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: A closer look at one of the most bizarre air freighters on the planet, the bulbous Airbus Beluga. The programme also charts the misfortunes of an American classic car enthusiast.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test-drive an Aston Martin DBS Convertible, a Ferrari California and a Lamborghini Gallardo Convertible through Romania, searching for the mountain highway built during the reign of the country's former dictator Nicolae Ceausescu - allegedly the best road to drive on in the world. Actor Eric Bana is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May travel to America for an interstate road trip, completing various challenges along the way. Starting in Miami, they each buy a car for less than $1,000 and drive to New Orleans, where they set out to give their vehicles away to people who suffered in Hurricane Katrina.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall visits Fort Worth, Texas, where he takes on a monster pancake challenge, a painful rodeo test, and local delicacy calves' testes in the world's largest Honky Tonk venue.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie hits San Antonio to sample the finest Tex-Mex food and a gigantic chicken fried steak - with no chicken. He also tests whether he has the moves for TV show Ninja Warrior.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actress Keeley Hawes, actor Stephen Mangan, comedian Kevin Bridges and physicist Brian Cox for the comedy panel show, in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Outnumbered star Hugh Dennis, presenter Ben Fogle, newsreader Kate Silverton and Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood are this week's guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee thinks the twins are too young to be taught about sex at school and that their teacher Miss Anstis is too stuck up to teach it. He resolves that it is his duty as a father to teach his children everything he knows about the facts of life, discovering only when it is too late that his knowledge is somewhat limited. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Charlie's school gets a bad Ofsted rating, Lee and Lucy start looking around for alternative schools. Despite Frank's protests, Geoffrey and Wendy offer to pay to send Charlie to be privately educated, which presents Lee and Lucy with a moral dilemma.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee interrupts Lucy's favourite TV programme by plonking himself down next to her on the sofa, eating her chocolates and talking loudly all the way through the dialogue. But when he suddenly can't remember the name of the leading actor and his hypochondria tells him he is losing his memory, Lucy's evening is completely ruined.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites David O'Doherty, Rose Matafeo and Ed Gamble to help him make sense of the world.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy show, with Josh Widdicombe, Zoe Lyons, Gary Delaney and James Acaster joining regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines in September 2015, through stand-up spots and improvised games. Chaired by Dara O Briain.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy show, with Ellie Taylor, Josh Widdicombe, Rob Beckett and James Acaster joining regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines hit the headlines in October 2015, through stand-up spots and improvised games. Chaired by Dara O Briain.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Millau Viaduct in South West France, which is the tallest bridge in the world and stretches two and a half kilometres over one of Europe's deepest valleys.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The First Raid of the Vikings
programme.desc: Experts analyse the content of Viking burial sites to learn more about Norse culture, beginning with the mass grave of a raiding party, which dates back to Roman times.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.

programme.title: Hitler v Churchill: The Eagle and the Lion
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary exploring the rivalry between the leaders of Britain and Germany during the Second World War, and their common experiences during the First World War.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: After the death of Cardinal Wolsey in 1530, Thomas Cromwell became Henry VIII's 'lap dog'. In order to do the king's bidding, he established a network of spies that steered Henry through his troubles with Rome, divorces, assassinations attempts and the establishment of a new religion. as this documentary reveals, though cunning and ambitious, none of these achievements proved sufficient to preserve his life.

programme.title: A Very British Murder with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian tells the story of one of the first high-profile killers - Dr Crippen, who was hanged in 1910 for poisoning and dismembering his wife - before turning her attention to the interwar period, when detective fiction reached the peak of its popularity at the hands of authors Agatha Christie and Dorothy L Sayers. After undergoing the elaborate initiation ceremony of the Detection Club, which was set up by a group of British writers in 1930, Lucy considers how Alfred Hitchcock's films and Graham Greene's books eclipsed the traditional murder-mystery story in the depiction of homicide.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Real Ark of the Covenant
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston goes in search of the location of the real Ark of the Covenant, believed to be held in a chapel in Ethiopia that is now in dire need of repair.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates theories that Hitler faked his suicide at the end of the Second World War and may have escaped from his Berlin bunker.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Man In The Iron Mask
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the truth behind the story of the man in the iron mask, who was held in the Bastille from 1698 to 1703, and may have been imprisoned for 40 years.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: In Search of the Real King Arthur
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the truth behind the legend of King Arthur, and looks for evidence of whether the mythical monarch was English, Scottish or Welsh.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: An early dusting of snow signals the end of autumn, a time when the forests are a blaze of red and gold and the animals prepare for the coming cold. The elk face hungry wolves as they move down from the mountains to feed in the valleys, while beavers rush to defend their habitat against the destructive ice, repairing dams and stocking underwater larders before the waters freeze over.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: An early dusting of snow signals the end of autumn, a time when the forests are a blaze of red and gold and the animals prepare for the coming cold. The elk face hungry wolves as they move down from the mountains to feed in the valleys, while beavers rush to defend their habitat against the destructive ice, repairing dams and stocking underwater larders before the waters freeze over.

programme.title: Tom Jones at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the singer's performances, from the start of his career in the 1960s to his appearance on Later with Jools Holland just before he celebrated his 70th birthday in 2010. The programme includes archive footage of the Welshman's appearances on The Dusty Springfield Show and Top of the Pops.

programme.title: You've Got a Friend: The Carole King Story
programme.desc: The award-winning US singer gives an account of her life, looking back on her upbringing in Brooklyn, and the subsequent success she enjoyed as part of husband-and-wife songwriting team Goffin and King in the 1960s, including the creation of global hits Take Good Care of My Baby, The Locomotion and Will You Love Me Tomorrow. By 1970, Carole was divorced and had moved to Los Angeles, where she created her classic solo album Tapestry. Now in her seventies, she reveals herself to be as much an environmental activist as a musician, lobbying Congress in defence of the wildlife and eco-systems in her beloved Idaho.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Exploring the history of Westminster Abbey, which dates back to the 11th century and houses more than 500 corpses, including those of Edward I, Elizabeth I, Charles Darwin and Isaac Newton, as well as staging 16 royal weddings. The episode also explores the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the somewhat macabre history of Scotland Yard, and revealing the lesser-known facts about one of the world's most famous police stations.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jack turns out to have a personal connection to the prime suspect in a teenage girl's murder, so he is taken off the case and replaced with another forensic scientist seconded to the Lyell Centre. But he finds himself instinctively drawn into the investigation, alienating himself from Nikki and the team as he tries to find an alibi for the supposed killer. Meanwhile, the victim's best friend is consumed with guilt, leading her to take drastic action. Crime drama, starring David Caves, Emilia Fox and Richard Lintern, with guest appearances by Haydn Gwynne and Ashley Walters.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh becomes the town hero after he saves a footballer from a booby-trapped paddock, but is soon brought back down to reality.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh offends everyone in Whyhope as he desperately tries to hide his secret past, and Meryl launches a charm offensive to help Charlie deal with her pregnancy grief.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer acquires a broken clock that holds the key to the honour of a family and a regiment thanks to some love letters from the Napoleonic era discovered inside. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. An ailing American millionaire becomes obsessed with saving the art treasures of a slowly sinking Venice and his granddaughter hires Lovejoy to help in the quest. However, as soon as the roguish dealer arrives, he becomes embroiled in a murder. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: An enigmatic character claims his life is in danger and calls Jim out to his remote castle in Brittany to act as his bodyguard. Drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim sets off to find out who stole the priceless porcelain figures he was supposed to be guarding for Charlie. His main suspects are the current owners, with whom Charlie is in negotiation for their sale.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Obadiah Hakeswill returns to create more mischief, kidnapping a beautiful aristocrat and undermining the discipline of Wellesley's men. Sharpe is dispatched to thwart his old foe, and manages to inflict a humiliating defeat on French forces in the process - but only at terrible personal loss to himself. Sean Bean, Elizabeth Hurley and Pete Postlethwaite star.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Fifteen Streets
programme.desc: Feature-length drama based on Catherine Cookson's novel set in early 20th-century Newcastle. Worker John O'Brien lives near poverty in a small house in the workers district, yet falls in love with teacher Mary, daughter of a rich family. Despite the pressures exerted by the social difference, the vigorous Mary refuses to allow outer circumstances destroy their relationship. Starring Sean Bean and Clare Holman.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Green-fingered amateur detectives Laura and Rosemary are called in to tackle a stubborn species of weed threatening an entire year's vintage at the Crickle Valley vineyard. However, they find themselves in the right place at the right time when the body of a wine critic is discovered on the premises. Murder mystery, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths are called to a monastery to restore a herb garden in time for a royal visit - but their pruning and planting is disrupted by the discovery of a corpse. As they investigate the death, the tight-knit community closes in around them. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Mike and the team are reacquainted with some familiar faces when investigating a suspicious suicide at the Brokenwood Women's Prison.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The detective and Ogden must put aside dealing with a personal matter when Nate Desmond is charged with murder. Crime drama, starring Yannick Bisson.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The detective helps a man search for his missing wife, while the rest of the Station House No 4 team try to solve a grisly murder.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Meryl's near-death experience sets Hugh on a journey of redemption and gives Penny the clarity she needs.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Jarrod's new job offer could mean Penny will leave Whyhope for ever - but is this what Hugh really wants?.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Pledge
programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance
programme.desc: Rob Beckett and Romesh Ranganathan host the annual entertainment extravaganza from the London Palladium, attended this year by the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge. This year's show features music from Robbie Williams, Jamie Cullum, Emeli Sande, Lewis Capaldi, the Kanneh Masons and Mabel, as well as this year's Britain's Got Talent winner, Colin Thackery, and comedy from Frank Skinner, Kerry Godliman and Flo & Joan. There are also appearances from the casts of West End shows Groan Ups, Mary Poppins and Come from Away, and dance spectacle from Zurcaroh and Cirque du Soleil.

programme.title: Bang on the Money

At the end of the contest, the most successful group could win up to Â£40,000. This week's teams are the Boro Bouncers from Middlesbrough and the Beach Chums from Cleethorpes.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars

programme.desc: Vehicle restorer Wayne Carini looks out for a BMW Isetta for his newly married daughter at the Bruce Weiner Microcar Museum sale.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China goes over budget to restore a BMW M3 E36, making it more difficult for Mike Brewer to achieve a profit when he sells it on.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is pleased to buy a V8-engined BMW 840 coupe - but when mechanic Edd China sees the condition it is in, he struggles to muster the same enthusiasm.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a cheap BMW M5 in a terrible condition, and Edd China has his work cut out trying to rejuvenate the dilapidated vehicle so it can turn a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to prove he can make money on a car without spending a fortune, while Edd China turns his attention to restoring a Mercedes-Benz SLK on a very tight budget.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike hunts down the cheapest Audi TT Quattro he can find, which is at the end of a 300-mile journey down to Cornwall, and later Edd tries to fix its gearbox.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The duo relocate across the Atlantic, and Mike Brewer heads to Chicago in search of a rust-free Pontiac GTO - a rare car that he knows will be perfect for kicking off Edd China's US-based workshop.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day six of the ranking tournament at Emirates Arena in Glasgow, featuring the opening semi-final.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Yogi risks a showdown with the law as he heads into South Australia. Elsewhere, Steve is under pressure with a truck out of action, and a run to a place he has never been to.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton hopes to make a handsome profit by selling some of the long-forgotten treasures that lie around his cluttered warehouse.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China works on restoring Mike Brewer's Mercedes 190-E, which features a Cosworth engine, incorporating a new suspension system and track rod end.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Skilled craftspeople are bringing Drew Pritchard's finds back to life. With demanding customers and high turnover, their hard work turns trash to treasure.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton hopes to make a handsome profit by selling some of the long-forgotten treasures that lie around his cluttered warehouse.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Katie's house, relationships and financial situation are in tatters. Feeling down and out, she recruits the help of an unlikely duo in her exes, Kris and Kieran.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Conclusions that can be drawn from the methods killers choose to dispose of their victims' bodies, and the techniques used by forensic investigators to discover them.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of artist Jordie Hudson, who vanished in April 2016. Police found the 46-year-old's glasses in a pool of blood and unearthed horrific surveillance footage.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The deaths of Alabama country store owner Billy Triplett and his wife Debbie in June 2001. Locals suspected their fate must have been connected with his illegal side-business of retailing alcohol. However, when word of a bloodstained stash of money reached investigators, they were shocked to realise the identity of the person wishing to conceal it.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI are called in when a bank manager is unable to open the vault, revealing a sophisticated burglary with losses of $8million.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: While the Arizona Humane Society helps a boxer fight for life, medical technician Traci Pepper takes her home and nurses her back to health.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown tends to Honey the dog, who has jumped out of a moving car to chase a cat. Plus, Tasmanian devils fight a mysterious illness, and a koala losing its sight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former model Meghan comes all the way from St Louis to find the perfect dress for her wedding to a baseball player.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Indian bride Rashi wants an American-style gown, while Shenelle returns for her fitting, nervous about seeing her custom dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Hannah has already purchased two gowns, but unimpressed by either, she returns to the salon hoping to find a gown that represents her bridal fantasy.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Tim needs additional help to save a turtle and dachshund Frankie is struggling to walk, with the doctors needing to act quickly to save him.

programme.desc: Ripper the pelican arrives at Dr Chris Brown's clinic with a foot injury, and Lena the cat faces serious problems after a nasty fall.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At just 24, Bettie Jo is housebound and reliant on her husband for even her most basic needs. Now, she does her best to shed the pounds.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of 30-year-old Joe, who must find the strength to face his past after losing his job and ending up mostly housebound.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. A college graduate with a once-promising career, Justin has eaten his life away to the point of never leaving the house for anything but food. Cameras follow his fortunes to turn matters around.

programme.desc: A bride wants a dress from her hometown that proves hard to obtain, while another customer takes a liking to a satin dress.

programme.desc: A bride tries on over 100 dresses in the search for the perfect look, while a woman getting married on a beach needs a gown that will cover her bare feet.

programme.desc: Caitie and her wedding planner father clash over a gown, while Danielle lost her mother to cancer, so her dad steps in to help her make the big decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Two brides are torn between a sexy look or a traditional one - and a disapproving father knows which he would prefer to see his daughter wearing.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride is more concerned with pleasing her mother than herself, while another customer has no idea what style of dress she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride cannot choose between two dresses she thinks are perfect - while another customer has tried on 50 gowns and thinks none of them are right.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former model Meghan comes all the way from St Louis to find the perfect dress for her wedding to a baseball player.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Zabrina looks for an extravagant ball gown for her wedding, while Cheryl is nervous about seeing her custom dress for the first time.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dina is ready to try on her dress, while Carla disagrees with her mother over how revealing her gown should be.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa and Larry return to a restaurant they used to eat in every day. The medium also comes to the aid of a woman who is struggling with negative feelings.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.sub-title: When a Bedroom Closes, a Closet Door Opens
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo decides to give Larry Jr's old bedroom a makeover after he moves out, and later, she surprises a pregnant woman with a reading.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa and Larry relive the 1980s with a trip to a rollerskating rink. The medium organises a surprise reading.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo is reunited with a woman she met when she was a prison visitor, and decides to pay a visit to another penitentiary.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: A man is forced to leave his home by his landlord, and only has days to accomplish the task of clearing out his 8ft-high mountain of belongings.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of nursing student Michelle Le, whose body was found in a remote Californian canyon four months after she disappeared in May 2011. Giselle Esteban was later found guilty of murdering the 26-year-old after she became jealous of her relationship Le had with the father of her child.

programme.title: Son of Sam: The Hunt for a Killer
programme.desc: Part one of two. American serial killer David Berkowitz, who eventually pleaded guilty to eight separate shooting attacks that began in New York City during the summer of 1976. Surviving victims, families of the deceased, and the detectives who worked on the case recount their stories.

programme.title: Son of Sam: The Hunt for a Killer
programme.desc: Part two of two. American serial killer David Berkowitz, who eventually pleaded guilty to eight separate shooting attacks that began in New York City during the summer of 1976. Surviving victims, families of the deceased, and the detectives who worked on the case recount their stories.
